message.content:
cs.LO, cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.PL

The paper deals with the decidability of energy games played on infinite game graphs induced by pushdown automata and one-counter automata. This involves concepts from logic (such as recursion) and graph theory (such as game graphs), which suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with game theory and decision problems, which are common topics in the cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) sub-category. The use of automata and graphs also suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with simulation games, which are related to simulation relations, a topic in the cs.PL (Programming Languages) sub-category.
